text: Clyde Luther Scott (August 29, 1924 â€“ January 30, 2018) was an American athlete. He competed professionally in the National Football League and earned an Olympic medal in the 110 meter hurdles. He was born in Dixie, Louisiana. He played for the Philadelphia Eagles from 1949 through 1952 and for the Detroit Lions in 1952. Scott died on January 30, 2018, at age 93.Former Arkansas football player Clyde Scott dies at age of 93 ==References== Category:1924 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Detroit Lions players Category:Philadelphia Eagles players Category:American hurdlers Category:Olympic silver medalists for the United States Category:Sportspeople from Louisiana
title: Clyde Scott
